revised_title: Ultracentrifuging Effects on Bean Root Tip Cells
tldr: The authors conducted an experiment using ultracentrifugation on bean root tip cells to study the effects on various cell structures. They discovered that different cell components, such as the nucleus, osmiophilic platelets, plastidome, pseudo-chondriome, and vacuome, have different specific gravities and are displaced accordingly. This research helps to clarify the structure and components of plant cytoplasm.
